page.title: 17Garton C.E. Church Part 2
page.content: The Department of the Environment has designated the building as 'A Church of International Importance'. Unfortunately the paintings now need restoring and the cost has been estimated at Â£250,000. Although the roof is sound the external sandstone is crumbling and repairs will incur a further Â£135,000. The Vicar also looks after two other churches.He holds one service in Garton Church every Sunday, sometimes two.The congregation,which has increased slightly,is usually about thirty.This is better than in many nearby villages.The Vicar feels that the role of the church is not as important as it used to be because the majority of villagers do not attend regularly.However most people still like to feel that the church is there for funerals,weddings and baptisms.
